snippet: Hours after a truce was reached to end fighting between rival groups of soldiers, thousands of civilians remained in churches and schools out of fear and uncertainty....
abstract: Cease-fire brings moment of calm to South Sudan capital of Juba after week of bloodshed between soldiers loyal to Pres Salva Kiir and Vice Pres Riek Machar.

byline.contributor: Josh Kron contributed reporting from Amsterdam.

lead_paragraph: Hours after a truce was reached to end fighting between rival groups of soldiers, thousands of civilians remained in churches and schools out of fear and uncertainty.

headline.main: Cease-Fire Appears to Hold in South Sudan’s Capital, Juba
headline.print_headline: Cease-Fire Appears to Hold in South Sudan Capital
